alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Southeast Carter (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 5:43PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Johnson and southeastern Carter Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elk Park, or 9 miles northwest of Newland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mountain City, Trade, Roane Mountain State Park, Neva, Hampton Creek Cove State Park, Elk Mills and Roan Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
